text: The Makalu Barun National Park is a national park in Himalayas of Nepal. In 1992, area was changed into this national park. There are 315 species of butterflies, 43 species of reptile, 16 species of amphibians, 78 species of fishes, 440 species of birds, and 88 species of mammals in this national park.Jha, S. G. (2003). Linkages between biological and cultural diversity for participatory management: Nepal’s experiences with Makalu-Barun National Park and buffer zone . Journal of the National Science Foundation of Sri Lanka 31 (1&2): 41–56. ==References== Category:National parks of Nepal
title: Makalu Barun National Park
